# supportsFrameSemantics(_:)

**Type Method**

Checks whether a particular feature is supported.

## Declaration

```swift
class func supportsFrameSemantics(_ frameSemantics: ARConfiguration.FrameSemantics) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **frameSemantics**: The frame semantics for which to check device support.

## Return Value

A boolean value that indicates whether the device supports the argument frame semantics.

## Discussion

Call this function before attempting to enable a frame semantic on your app’s configuration. For example, if you call `supportsFrameSemantic(.sceneDepth)` on [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldTrackingConfiguration], the function returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] on devices that support the LiDAR scanner’s depth buffer.



## Enabling frame features

- **frameSemantics**: The set of active semantics on the frame.
- **ARConfiguration.FrameSemantics**: Types of optional frame features you can enable in your app.
